website_summaries.verdict: A reliable, single-can crusher with the durability to handle thousands of cans — and a container to catch them..
pros: Compact sized crusher with bin to store cans
Able to be mounted easily on the wall
Made from plastic, but holds up really well
Not rated for outdoor use, but plastic construction makes it hold up well in the weather
cons: Does not have the flexibility to crush more than a standard-sized can
Must be lubricated from time to time

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away! Company Doesn't Stand Behind Their Product!!
customer_reviews.text: This plastic can crusher worked well for about 3 months until the handle broke off, rendering the device useless. Ok, it is made of plastic, but surely the company would stand behind their product? I contacted them multiple times and was ghosted after their initial response. Don't get this one unless you want to add more crap to your local land fill. I suggest getting a metal can crusher from a different company who will stand behind their products.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with my purchase! Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely Perfect Product! Extremely sturdy. Easy to install. Made of resin-type plastic, which makes it much better than metal ones. I had bought a metal one, and it was a piece of junk. This one doesn’t bend at all, and the pull down and pull up is very smooth, doesn’t bend or shift, and the self-dumping of the can to the bin is all one motion. It only crushes 12 oz. cans, and not 16, but I don’t have many 16 oz. cans. The quality is excellent. I’m positive I’ll have it as long as my last crusher of a different brand but made of the same materials, which was 20 years. Highly impressed!
customer_reviews.author: D. McLin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and it has been outside on a post in the middle of my forest land for 6 months. Still looks and works as good as new. Very easy to crush cans, very easy to mount, I love that I can have a garbage can underneath and the crushed cans just fall into it. I would be extremely happy if this can crusher can survive being outside on a post 24/7/365 in midwest weather for at least a few years. Not sure that it will, but also understand that is not really its intended use.
customer_reviews.author: VelocityTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Would have been 5 star but it broke after 11 months.  Got free replacement!
customer_reviews.text: The moving plastic crushing mechanism completely broke apart after 11 months. I contacted Dial Industries that day. I emailed pics of the broken bits and Dial sent a replacement via UPS on the same day. Any product can break if there is even a minor flaw in production. What matters is how the company responds. I really like the product - glad Dial stood behind it.
customer_reviews.author: JrsBat

customer_reviews.title: Great Aluminum Can Crusher and Collection Bin!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Dial Industries Easy Pull Can Crusher first, and then ordered the Dial Industries Easy Pull Aluminum Can Collection Bin when I realized it would be so helpful if it worked. It did! and does! The collection bin is specifically made for the Dial Pull Can Crusher, and I would recommend purchasing the two together. It fits securely, and the crushed cans almost always drop directly into it. Every once in a while one catches at the top, but can be dropped into the bin by hand easily enough. The bin holds a good number of cans. Both the can crusher and the bin are well made, and serve their purpose well! Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: W. Tyson

customer_reviews.title: Great Can Crusher
customer_reviews.text: Our family drinks canned sparkling like crazy and we had a ton of empty cans to put in the recycle bin, which took up a lot of room. We got this can crusher and now our youngest collects all the cans and loves to crush them into a box. It's well constructed and easy to use. I put foosball rod oil on the sliding rods as they felt a bit stiff at first and now they slide super easy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 12 oz short cans only!!
customer_reviews.text: I should have done more research before buying this. We love so much about this can crusher - but it has one major flaw. It can not crush tall cans. I drink truly, and the cans are tall slim cans. They are too tall to fit in the crusher. 16 oz cans wouldn't fit either. Such a bummer. We'll keep it because it is sturdy and easy to use (and it's already attached to our wall.). We wouldn't buy it if we had to choose all over again though.
customer_reviews.author: Amy C

customer_reviews.title: A very good product!
customer_reviews.text: I rated the sturdiness for this product at four. I probably would’ve rated 4 1/2 if I could. It mostly is made of a sturdy plastic. It does a very good job of crushing 12 ounce cans. I cannot handle cans any larger. I am glad I purchased this model. Previously I had purchased a metal model from a local hardware store. Pretty sure it came from China. That one had broken on the first can I try to crush. I have crushed well over 100 cans with this product, and it works quite well. One of the things I really like about this model is that it automatically dumps the crushed can in whatever you set beneath it.
customer_reviews.author: James S. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Good Initial Impressions
customer_reviews.text: This can crusher was purchased to replace one of the cheap stamped metal can crushers that are sold all over Amazon. While the cheap one was ok for soda cans, it could not easily crush the thicker flavored water cans. In fact, the cheap crusher barely lasted a total of one hundred soda and water cans. This can crusher, while mostly made of thick plastic, is much sturdier and handles the thicker cans with ease. I also like that it drops the cans in the basket. But only time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Works Very Well
customer_reviews.text: This can crusher works as expected and crushes 12oz aluminum cans with ease. I was a little concerned after reading other product reviews/questions that indicated it may not be sturdy because it's made of plastic, etc. I have not found that to be the case. The long arm gives plenty of leverage and doesn't bend or deflect. It's made to mount to a vertical surface and I have it attached to a 6"x6" support column in my basement where the crushed cans drop directly into my recycle bin. Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: bt

customer_reviews.title: Going strong after crushing over 100 cans!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to mount this to the wall in my home office, so it's a standalone. I lay it flat and simply put my foot on the back piece to hold it down and crush the can. Works like a charm. I saw some other posts about this breaking, but I've crushed over 100 cans with no problem. I just wish it had a larger opening to handle taller cans. This works for me because I don't have to empty the recycle bin as often.
customer_reviews.author: ToddInVA

customer_reviews.title: Great for small cans, but won’t work for large ones
customer_reviews.text: If this thing crushed 16 oz and other tall cans, I would absolutely love it, but it only crushed smaller cans. The quality is good, and the design is sleek. I enjoy having and using it, but at the end of the day, I still had to buy a larger crusher for larger cans, as they are commonly used for lots of beverages now days.

customer_reviews.title: A+ Can crusher
customer_reviews.text: I've had this can crusher for a couple of weeks and prefer it any day over a standard metal-built can crusher. They both get the job done, however I find the Easy Pull Can Crusher easier to use. It is definately easier on the hands and arms when you are crushing a large amount of cans in one sitting. The collection bin is a nice added feature and keeps the area clean.
customer_reviews.author: JKrun

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ!
customer_reviews.text: Easy pull, good crush. Works far better than the cheap metal ones. In this case plastic is superior to metal. Even has a built in stop so it couldn't crush your finger. Put a bag under it and the cans just drop in automatically when you raise the handle. The handle stays upright and out of the way between uses. Makes it fun!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin H

customer_reviews.title: You've broken the rest, Now try the best!
customer_reviews.text: Easy and short review. Pay the extra $10 for this one. Simply said, the handle is designed properly, unlike the rest, with NO cheap grommets holding it together. Rather a simple and correctly designed molded polymer one that allows the torque to be released in the handle design. Works perfectly. Design also allows can to drop into your container without fuss. Will only accept 12 oz. cans (shouldn't be guzzling those big ones anyway.)
customer_reviews.author: MarkDS

customer_reviews.title: Shoddy can crusher
customer_reviews.text: This is the sorriest piece of junk that I have ever bought in my life. I purchased this can crusher in August 2018 and six months later the handle broke off in my hand. This item is overpriced and I wouldn’t buy it again. I recommend that non-performance waste their money on this item.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan W. Rice

customer_reviews.title: I've been waiting to write a review until we've used it a while
customer_reviews.text: I see reviews from people almost literally after they opened the box and installed the unit. We've been using this device for 1 year and for the most part its' been great! However, after around 11 months it started loosening up on the handle and now its' completely broken. The design of this crusher is great, it hangs very snug on the wall and isn't an eye sore. I just wish it would last longer than a year.
customer_reviews.author: G Cox

customer_reviews.title: Very nice an sturdy, much better than the flimsy one we had before
customer_reviews.text: It tips the unit as it crushes the cans so just put a box underneath it to catch the cans. The cans don't always end up in the box. It has an option bin but that bin does not seem large enough. It would be nice to have some kind of shoot on it for the cans go down into a bag or something.
customer_reviews.author: G. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: It works very well.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it because of the high rating. I have crushed about 500 cans so far. I come from a industrial back ground so metal construction should been my first choice. Time will tell if this was a wise choice.
customer_reviews.author: joe m

customer_reviews.title: flag decal was broken upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: this is my 2nd can crusher of this brand/style. works great and the first one has held up for 5+ years and shows no signs of stopping. this one seems to be the same, however i was very saddened that the decal was broken in to spots. was looking forward to having a more patriotic crusher(the old one didnt have a flag label), but the sticker is really too cracked to use. ohh well.
customer_reviews.author: wezzz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what we were looking for. The reason we chose this one was because it is made in the US. We’ve been using it for a couple weeks now and it’s perfect. Love that as it crushes it rotates so the can goes directly into the bin I set on the ground below.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Good, But Only For Standard Cans
customer_reviews.text: I bought the crusher with the bin.It was a bit pricey, all things considered. The construction seems sturdy. You need to mount this firmly to a surface. The wall screws provided are worthless as they pull out of the wall upon first use.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer Mike

customer_reviews.title: Two Years In - Working well
customer_reviews.text: Two years into this crusher being used occasionally it is still working like new. It has crushed hundreds of cans. I suggest mounting it to a framing stud, and do realize it will reverberate in the house a bit. Years later, one day my wife said, "Oh, that's what that sound is." She is two floors up from the basement cave. lol
customer_reviews.author: Brendan R.

customer_reviews.title: I really like the way it functions
customer_reviews.text: I really like the way it functions. It doesn't have the weak pivot point the cheaper ones have. Although this one is made of a plastic it is very strong. We have a tub sitting under it on to top the recycle bin. Once you crush the can it will drop right into the tub. Just have to wipe off the sticky once in a while. (or rinse cans before crushing.) Then the tub gets dumped into the bin. Here is the recycle bin we have though we actually found it cheaper on a big box store's website.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Sanders

customer_reviews.title: this thing works and is fun.
customer_reviews.text: Ok... I bought one because the ones made of sheet metal just flat broke. This thing is kinda big but it mounts easy. It will most likely not do any can over 12oz... but on those? it works great.. fun to use and just drops the crushed cans in any receptical you put under it. My dad was so impressed that he asked me to get him one.
customer_reviews.author: Doran Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Great can crusher
customer_reviews.text: We have had this for several months now and I have held off my review as some people indicated they have had a problem after a few months use. We go through a good number of cans and crush all of them to minimize the space used in our recycle can. We have never had any issue using the crusher. Even my 7 year old grandson enjoys crushing cans (it is his chore when they stay over for a visit). It is geared well enough he has no issue using it. One thing I remind people to do when using any can crusher, slightly dimple the can by squeezing the middle before crushing. Easier on you and on the crusher.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Can crusher
customer_reviews.text: I shopped for a new can crusher to replace one that had broke. After reading reviews on the Dial Industries Aluminum Can Crusher I decided to give it a try. It works perfectly. One feature I really like is how has you pull the handle to crush the can the unit tilts forward so when you raise the handle the crushed can drops freely into either a box or garbage can placed underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Doug G. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra money vs. other cheaply made can crushers
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to purchase a simple can crusher for almost $30, now I am very happy that I did. I have bought several can crushers that were made of metal and they did not last. This can crusher is substantial compared to the metal crushers and does well when crushing all sizes of cans. The only hard part of installation was figuring out where to put it. So save yourself some money and time and buy this can crusher first.
customer_reviews.author: Dezzilou

customer_reviews.title: Crushes cans quick
customer_reviews.text: The self ejecting can feature is very appreciated. Crushes cans easily, don't have any real complaints. Maybe the overall construction could've used more metal instead of entirely plastic for the long term, but as of now it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ho

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t do tall cans
customer_reviews.text: This thing won’t do tallboys. Whit Claws? Nope. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Louis

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: My In laws had a very old can crusher and I was looking for an updated version. We drink a lot of canned soda and this works perfectly. I installed it right over our recycling container and the crushed cans fall right into it. The kids love to crush the cans also.
customer_reviews.author: Big Joe Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Works as designed.  Lasts a long time!
customer_reviews.text: I bought my Easy Pull Can Crusher in June 2010 and it is still going strong. My sister-in-law has one she installed in 2007 that finally failed; not due to bad design, but because one of the mounting screws came loose and, with continued use, the base twisted and one of the guide shafts bent. This is made of durable plastic and the wall provides needed structural rigidity, so it has to be anchored to the wall securely for proper operation. I expect my crusher to last for many more years to come.
customer_reviews.author: David N.

customer_reviews.title: Greatest Can Crusher Ever
customer_reviews.text: I am writing this after using this can crusher for 10 YEARS. Yes, I have had this installed and crushing cans in my garage for the last 10 YEARS and it hasn't failed me yet. I can assure you that I have crushed over 20,000 cans on this thing easily. It's still going strong. I only wish they made a model that would crush the 16 oz tall boy and red bull cans that are popular now. If you want a quality can crusher, spend the extra $ and get this one. It's well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Fits on 12 oz cans
customer_reviews.text: Great for standard soda or beer cans. It won’t work on taller than 12oz cans. Great to smash them to save space in the recycling can when the garbage company comes for the recycling bin they provided.
customer_reviews.author: FD Firefighter 121

customer_reviews.title: Proper Unit
customer_reviews.text: This is the proper unit. I got this one because I wanted my wife to be able to use it, and wanted things simple. Well, they are simple and smooth. I would have given it 5 stars if the cans crushed to a little smaller size, and if it was made with better materials. I can see where in a year or so of use that there will be potentially be a crack or something in the plastic where the shafts go through the arms and such, but we'll see. I would love to see this design made out of billet aluminum!
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Z

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Crusher
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy construction! My father in law has had this one for many years and we've dominated hundredses of cans through it. When I completed my shop build a few months ago, this was my finishing touch. With limited floor space, this allows me to empty as needed and prevents me from throwing cans away. I do wish it fit 16 oz. cans and it is a little spendy, but it's still really worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent can crusher
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through quite a few cheaper can crushers and this is the best I have used so far. It's never going to come off of your wall with regular use if you can find a stud in your wall. I wish it held cans larger than 12 ounces but it's not a huge deal for me.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Works well....for standard cans.
customer_reviews.text: I wish there was some kind of adjustment, or it could accommodate larger cans (monster, beer, skinny soda cans). As is it only does well for normal sized cans. So if you only drink 12oz cokes, this is the crusher for you! Otherwise you have to do some pre-crushing, and it does not hold that can in place very well.
customer_reviews.author: Stachiapet

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my grandfather, he wishes it took larger 1lb cans. But it is easy to use and he is happy. Pleased it was made in the USA
customer_reviews.author: KCayer

customer_reviews.title: Simple one-handed crushing and surprising durability
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting it, but this is one of my favorite purchases on Amazon. One handed crushing is extremely easy. Based on the photos, I naively thought this had an all metal construction, but it turned out to be predominantly plastic. Despite that, it has been surprisingly durable. So I wouldn't have to mar any walls, I zip tied mine to a kitchen shelf, and it works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: arielleraeanne

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy but only for "normal" sized cans
customer_reviews.text: This will NOT work for skinny tall cans (like White Claw). I'd give it 5 stars if it was a hair larger. Works great though for standard 12oz cans. Good crush and drops into the trash can under it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan B

customer_reviews.title: Makes can crushing SUPER easy
customer_reviews.text: This thing really makes crushing a snap. The leverage it creates makes it so easy to crush that my 8-yo son has named himself the official "Can-Crusher" of the house. I thought the built-in can catcher would be just a gimmick, but it really does make a difference in terms of speed when you've got more than a couple of cans to crush at one time. Bottom line, if you're gonna buy a can crusher, this one is definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne J.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice can crusher !!!
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought me a can crusher 2 years ago and it was definitely on it's last leg I did some research and found this one on a couple of best lists as #1 so I just got it for Christmas installed that day and have probably crushed 50 or so cans so far so good hoping for at least 10 years of use looks like it can handle it !!!
customer_reviews.author: sydelle

customer_reviews.title: It Really IS Easy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about a year ago, and I am very pleased with the quality of the can crusher. The easy slide out can holder keeps the mess under control and holds a lot of crushed cans (approximately a tall kitchen trash bag full!), so you are not frustrated with constantly having to stop and empty the canister. My husband likes that the unit is enclosed enough that the soda does not splash out and make the wall around the unit all sticky. Because of that feature, we have it conveniently mounted in the laundry room, so even the grandkids are able to reach it and crush the cans - which they actually think is kind of fun!
customer_reviews.author: kmalone

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: **UPDATE** It has been close to 3 years since I purchased this. I had it mounted outside at the edge of a porch for 2 years. I moved it inside about a year ago so we didn't have to stand out in the cold during winter weather to crush cans. This thing is still crushing like a champ! Extremely easy to use!!! I have had 2 cervical spine surgeries and a lot of trouble with my neck, trap muscles and other issues. I can use this can crusher with NO PROBLEMS!!!! Easy pull in the title is NO LIE!!!! It's perfect for me!
customer_reviews.author: Zabrina

customer_reviews.title: Works well for aluminum cans
customer_reviews.text: It works well on soda cans. Doesn't take much effort to crush the cans. It doesn't work with plastic bottles because they are too big to fit properly. It does require a very strong mounting because the long arm exerts a substantial amount of force. I used Togglers because the location had drywall and no studs. I like how the cans automatically fall into the trash can below the unit.
customer_reviews.author: rdagger

customer_reviews.title: Fun and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: So if your on the fence on a plastic can crusher don’t be this thing is amazing. Fun and easy to use. Put the can pull the handle down and it drops the can into the bucket.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Save time and work
customer_reviews.text: I knew it was only for 12 oz cans or smaller, as described. I wish it did 16 oz cans as well. That said, it is a wonderful time and labor saving device for my son who collects and sells cans. I highly recommend this for anyone who primarily crushes 12oz cans. Easy to operate and mount on any solid vertical surface with enough substance to withstand pulling the lever repeatedly. Almost 100% maintenance free.
customer_reviews.author: Rory G.

customer_reviews.title: 10 YEARS OLD AND STILL WORKS GREAT!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this can crusher on May 30th 2010. It's still going strong! I had to oil the guide rod bushings last month, for the first time. Best Amazon purchase I've ever made!
customer_reviews.author: Reality Check

customer_reviews.title: Best Can Crusher!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy can crusher. It doesn't hurt my hand like the cheaper other brand can crushers do. I've had this can crusher for over six months and I've crushed probably 1000 cans or so, and this crusher still works like new.
customer_reviews.author: JG, Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Can Crusher!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to mount with the 2 screws provided. I placed a Hommer Bucket under the crusher which worked well to catch crushed cans. I owned several crushers in the past, by far the easiest to use from loading can to pulling the easy pull handle with little effort. Once crushed the can drops into the bucket below. I was able to crush over 100 cans in several minutes. Easy maintence and easy to clean. The only drawback it won't do can larger than 12oz.
customer_reviews.author: RoyW

customer_reviews.title: Good Can Crusher
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this crusher and after checking it out it will probably crush cans very well. My only issue is that the cans aren't completely crushed, they are still about 2 inches thick. I want my cans crushed as flat as possible so I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Halfton57

customer_reviews.title: Crushed cans fall into the bin
customer_reviews.text: You do not need to handle the cans after they are put into the crusher. I like this feature because not all cans are as empty as you might hope. The tall cans are not an issue, just give them a little twist to make them short enough to fit in and they smash fine also.
customer_reviews.author: dvbavcon

customer_reviews.title: Crush cap steadily deformed with each use and now completely binds up after 1.5 years.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well when first installed, but degraded rapidly with each use. I got 1.5 years before removal. Stay clear of plastic can crushers.
customer_reviews.author: Dan D.

customer_reviews.title: works extremely well
customer_reviews.text: Well, it works as well as a can crusher should. It replaced a unit from a B-alliterative chain store, which lasted about a year each time (three units in total), then had to be replaced. I've used this one for only a month, but it's much more pleasant to use (although with the absolutely required collection bin, sold separately, it's much bulkier). How much can you write about a can crusher? It works well and easily, and appears to be more durable than the one I replaced, although with the collection bin it adds bulk to the wall . I don't mind that, but I'm single. A spouse might object to having it hanging on the dining room wall.
customer_reviews.author: lithos

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use
customer_reviews.text: We bought this after doing some extensive comparing and it hasn't dissapointed. We love that it was made in the USA and made exceptionally well. Even though it is mostly plastic it is quite strong and sturdy and makes crushing cans even a little fun. Wish they mad a model that can take the taller energy drink cans but with a little pre crushing even those can go through.
customer_reviews.author: HSJ

customer_reviews.title: 12oz cans only, but best by far!!
customer_reviews.text: Used this can crusher in my friends garage... Bought one for myself. So easy to use and having it drop into the drum without touching the can is genius. Too bad the wife drinks those skinny tall cans...those don't fit. Make a larger unit!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan H.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to mount and use!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great can crusher. Very easy to use. You can hang a trash bag below it and the cans will fall right into the bag.
customer_reviews.author: EEW

customer_reviews.title: Still crushing for 3 years
customer_reviews.text: Wife thought this was a expensive dumb buy. Said we could just crush cans with our feet, though we have ceramic tiled floors. We take ours to a metal recycler and get money back. After 3 years of trips and money in the hand every trip, its still on the wall crushing and the wife? Well seems she is not complaining and the money "in her purse" is doing well thank you! You will find the major portion of my reviews rate the product high. We don't have much money, so I spend a lot of time researching a reviewing articles before purchasing, so far this has worked and we have been very happy with 99% of our purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Friese

customer_reviews.title: This is probably the best can crusher I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best can crusher I've ever owned. I'm partial to the ones that have the cage that you can load several cans in at a time, but always had problems with the cans not crushing completely and getting stuck. This unit actually tips toward you as it's crushing the can so when you start to release, the unit's already in an angle facing down, so th can easily falls out. My wife loves it too!
customer_reviews.author: Ken Bowersox Jr

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: We go thru a lot of aluminum cans and this is great for recycling. My grand-blessings love using it: as soon as they walk in the door they ask if there are any cans to crush?
customer_reviews.author: Morticia

customer_reviews.title: Limited in can size it accepts.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine can crusher but it accommodates only 'normal'-sized cans - the familiar 12oz cans. It doesn't accommodate cans such as the skinny flavored water ones, nor a 16 oz beer can.
customer_reviews.author: Coffee Lover

customer_reviews.title: Flag decal arrows did not line up. Decal doesn't look nice.
customer_reviews.text: lined up the arrows perfectly. Still put the decal at a slant. Now it looks horrible. Wish it came with the decal already on. I've done self stick wallpaper before no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Niles

customer_reviews.title: Good Can Crusher
customer_reviews.text: Installed it in a group home for someone with some physical limitations. Worked great. They had tried a non wall mounted model and it didn't last a week. This one seems robust and easy to use. The long handle means it doesn't take a lot of strength to operate and your fingers won't get caught. The only problem is the can falls out when you first pull the handle. You just have to hold the can steady while you pull the handle down a few inches, until the mechanism grabs the can.
customer_reviews.author: Mick Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Best Can Crusher
customer_reviews.text: Best can crusher on the market in my opinion. Crushes can completely flat and then drops the can into the bucket placed underneath. Don't have to use your hands to remove can like other can crushers. My friends were impressed by its ease of use and are ordering one for themselves.
customer_reviews.author: MotherPeacock58

customer_reviews.title: Awesome can crusher
customer_reviews.text: Been using the Easy Pull since March-16 and have to say this is an awesome can crusher. I installed it outside and have crushed probably 15-30 gallon trash bags full with crushed cans. No problems. I do put waterproof grease on the metal rods to keep it working smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Playvos

customer_reviews.title: Well made!
customer_reviews.text: Really well made. It will fit Coors Light cans incase anyone is wondering. Don’t let the plastic material discourage you. When you have it in your hands you’ll see what I mean. It’s very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra $
customer_reviews.text: We were crushing our cans one at a time with a large hammer before we bought this Easy Pull Can Crusher! It was messy work no one wanted to do. I read many reviews and knew the cheaper devises would not be worth trying. So I took a chance and purchased this more expensive Can Crushing System. It is worth every penny! The quality is good. The easy pull is just that, 'an easy pull'! The cans are crushed, and then fall into the Collection Bin. Nice and neat....no mess!!!!
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for. No more cheap junk that is hard to pull, and twists out of shape in a month.
customer_reviews.text: Made of hard sturdy plastic. No rust. No bending or twisting. Put a bucket under it, and crushed cans fall right in.
customer_reviews.author: gttjr1950

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and use.
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on a post on my porch and it works great. The only complaint I had was from my brother who was visiting who said it was too easy. I highly recommend this. Best can crusher I’ve had.
customer_reviews.author: Sheralan Marrott

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fit all cans, works great on 12oz standard
customer_reviews.text: I wish there was a version that worked on larger cans. My 4 year old loves this thing, but it won’t fit monster or red bull, probably others also.
customer_reviews.author: Es

customer_reviews.text: This is my second one . I got this for my vacation home. Love it! If only aluminum would go back up.
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Years later it's still going strong. We keep it on the side of our house outside by the trash. Good stuff! ========= Just crushed two garbage cans full of uncrushed cans, it was fun and I wish I had more cans. And I quote steve martin from "the jerk" "Get away from the cans, he's after the cans! More cans!" ---------- update 4-26-13 --------- I keep this thing on the side of my outside shed, I live in Seattle so it rains all the time. Never once put vasaline on the rails like they say you should, and it still works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Hannibal

customer_reviews.title: Works - pretty simple!
customer_reviews.text: I mounted the crusher on the wall above my recycle box so all I need to do is crush the can and let it drop directly into the box. Nothing taller than the standard 12 oz cans will fit, and they are easily crunched down to two inches. A great job made possible with sturdy arms made of durable plastic composite.
customer_reviews.author: gundish

customer_reviews.title: can crusher
customer_reviews.text: this is a very cool product that works very well i also bought the bin that attaches to the crusher which makes it very handy remember if you place just a trash can under the crusher the flies and bus can REALLY be attracted i then put a small rag over the opening to keep bugs away then remove it when i crush a can. my only concern is that the handle seems very cheaply made i just hope it last if the manufacturer would upgrade to a metal handle and charge more they would have a SUPER product so far i love it but will it last 5-10 years time will tell
customer_reviews.author: ben klink

customer_reviews.title: flawless
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this can crusher for 7 months it has been flawless for undented cans. You must hold dented can in the crusher. I love the way the crushed is self ejected I loop the handle of a standard shopping bag over the crusher the bag collects 99% of the cans. Walta
customer_reviews.author: J. Ahlgrim

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, Easy Crush
customer_reviews.text: This is great, has so much more leverage then my old. Crushes cans easy. Wish it opened further for 16 oz cans. Also I hope it lasts. Last crusher was steel and it aged out.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Ni

customer_reviews.title: Husband's favorite new toy!
customer_reviews.text: This is my husband's favorite new toy! He loves how easy it is to use and that it automatically ejects the can when it's done crushing. We will be buying more as gifts for family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Rooskandar

customer_reviews.title: Can Crusher
customer_reviews.text: This item is fantastic. Only problem is that it does not handle 16 oz cans. Simple solution, simply hand crush the cans a bit then insert and crush the remainder of the way.
customer_reviews.author: terry cuero

customer_reviews.title: Not good product
customer_reviews.text: I use my new M can crush it today I just Put it up I squish 10 cans and a broke
customer_reviews.author: Mark Sherwood

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Does what it said it would. I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Odden

customer_reviews.title: Get this one
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and just simply works. Have had it for a few months now and it’s much nicer than the last one I had. Only bummer is it can’t handle anything bigger than a 12oz can. For me? Not a huge deal. For others? Could make this a non starter.
customer_reviews.author: ERA

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and great quality
customer_reviews.text: Love! Have used others that say they are heavy duty but they lie!! This one truly is!!! Very sturdy and easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Rachel T

customer_reviews.title: Glad I spent a few dollars more. Well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old granddaughter uses this to crush cans. Easy. Fast. Effective.
customer_reviews.author: E S

customer_reviews.title: It looks nice compared to others
customer_reviews.text: First one broke after about 10 cans, and I was being gentle with it. Got a refund then bought another from Ace, hope this one lasts. It looks nice compared to others, that's why I am giving it another try but I am surprised by all the high reviews.
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: Works very well. My old crusher didn't seem to ...
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. My old crusher didn't seem to have nearly as much "oomph" as this one. I'm a bug guy and can crush cans one handed if needs be so when the old one failed to crush properly that was a problem. This one results in flat cans that drop directly into the recycling with no fuss.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wade

customer_reviews.title: Great crusher, bad packaging.
customer_reviews.text: Due to the way the flag sticker is packaged (rolled up and loose in the box) it is pretty much guaranteed to be cracked when you unpack it. It needs to be inside the collection bin to protect it. The can crusher itself is great, but expect to throw away the sticker. I removed 1 star for the horrible sticker packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Other than one of the two screws needed to install this product was missing, I have no issues. The problem was in packaging, as a small crinkled piece of tape was used to stick the loose screws to the back of the plastic crusher. Then the shipping box had cracks in it, so the screw apparently came loose and fell out during shipping. Missing hardware seems to be the norm these days no matter where you purchase products. So far the crusher works great. Time will tell as it is made of plastic, but seems to be sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: ooooooo

customer_reviews.title: Good and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this product for 3 years and it works as good as it did the first day. Just make sure you fasten it to a sold part of the wall. I didn't have a stud to attach it to, and after a year or so the top screw anchors I used (not supplied with product, so not their fault) started pulling loose. I used better anchors in the existing holes (ones rated to 75lbs) and haven't had an issue since. This proudct crushes cans very small and is VERY easy to crush without using a large amount of force.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: NOT worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: We have had this can crushed mounted for 3 months and it no longer works. The metal bars are bent and won’t allow the handle to lower. We are an average family of four so it’s certainly not from overuse. We are very upset to have spent the amount of money we did on this product to have it be useless this quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Schaub

customer_reviews.title: Built to Last.......my 6 month review!!!
customer_reviews.text: 6 months in and not a mark on it. I crush a lot of cans.....average 50 a week. Fun to use and built tuff. Still going strong a year later. I maybe crushed 500 cans with ease. I mounted mine in the kitchen and I place a garbage can under it to catch the cans. Kinda fun to use!!
customer_reviews.author: steve k felton

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Love this. So easy to use and to install. We put it in the kitchen. Really good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Daniels

customer_reviews.title: OK if you need it
customer_reviews.text: Generally if you have a can crusher, you don't need this. However, I have mine screwed to a tree and can't put a trash can directly under it because of the shape of the tree. So this is a solution, if you have the brand of can crusher that it fits. Had to replace one of the little tits that hold it to the crusher with a screw and nut, which cost it a star, but I've had it about 5 years outside in the weather and still works -- Larry
customer_reviews.author: Larry Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Great crusher for 12oz cans
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job, easy to pull. Only downside is it cannot fit anything bigger than a 12oz can.
customer_reviews.author: Zac Walker

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, saves motion, made in USA
customer_reviews.text: Crushed over 2200 cans so far without a glitch, I love the feature that it tips the can out for you after crushing it , we just put a 30 gallon can with a bag inside and eliminate sticky fingers!
customer_reviews.author: Pen61

customer_reviews.title: Well made but no usable on all can sizes
customer_reviews.text: It's well made. It's durable. It's easy to install. It's easy to use. 5 star product except that my Stout size cans cannot fit in it, which means it will not get used. I have to take off a star for that. They really need to add in their description the can sizes that will fit.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Payne

customer_reviews.title: Quick and Easy
customer_reviews.text: Installs quickly, saves room. Just installed over garbage can, put can pull lever and when done it falls directly into the can.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This product is sturdy and has been doing its job faithfully. It’s worth the few extra bucks
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Great Crusher
customer_reviews.text: This is our second crusher. The first one lasted 6 or seven years before the stainless steel rods began to bend after hundreds of cans. The new one has been in use for a little over a month now and is working famously. The only difference in the two is that, now, it will accept the taller Coors Light 12 oz cans without pinching them to make them a little shorter. Thank you Easy Pull for the engineering change. It will still crush the tall high energy drink cans with a pinch for shortening them. Recommend this for all.
customer_reviews.author: savwick

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing...the whole system, manufactured well and sturdy and the can holds well plenty of cans! Ez to remove and dump, quick rinse with a hose after dumping and its like new! I just pinch the cans a bit to make it a bit easier to crush and BAM! done. you will like this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

product_meta.title: Dial Industries Easy Pull Aluminum Can Crusher with Collection Bin
product_meta.description: Style Name:Can Crusher with BinThe easy pull aluminum can crusher with collection bin has a patented pivoting mechanical system, making this crusher 75 % easier to use than other can crushers. With it's child safety stops, it is easy for all the family to use. The system is auto dispensing so cans drop automatically in to the collection bin and you do not need to touch sharp and sticky crushed cans. It can turn approximately 4 bags of uncrushed soda, Beer or other cans into 1 bag. The collection bin can hold up to 48 cans. This product is proudly made in USA. Dial Industries has been in business producing quality plastics for over four decades. Over 90% of our product line is made in America. Dial Industries proprietary line of storage and organizational products, supply some of the largest and most respected retailers in the world
feature_bullets: Patented pivoting Mechanical system, making this crusher 75% easier to use than other can crushers; child safety stops keeps fingers from getting pinched
Auto dispensing so cans drop automatically in to the collection bin, so that you do not need to touch Sharp and Sticky crushed can
Rotating Hand grip for comfort and ease of use; Quality construction and very durable
Turns approximately 4 bags of uncrushed cans into 1 bag; made in USA
Clean, fun and easy to use for all ages; bin comes with an American flag decal

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,649 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Dial Industries Easy Pull Aluminum Can Crusher With Collection Bin,
